alert.note: Alert for Johnston (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 20 at 7:46PM EST until January 25 at 3:00AM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Carolina... Neuse River At Smithfield affecting Johnston County. Lower Roanoke River At Roanoke Rapids affecting Halifax and Northampton Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Neuse River at Smithfield. * WHEN...Until early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Minor flooding begins. Flooding begins along the Neuse Riverwalk. Water nears the base of the holding tank at the water treatment plant. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 PM EST Saturday the stage was 15.5 feet. - Bankfull stage is 15.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:15 PM EST Saturday was 15.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage Wednesday afternoon and continue falling to 13.5 feet Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm EST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Tue Wed Neuse River Smithfield 15.0 15.5 Sat 7 pm EST 15.3 15.3 15.3 14.8 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rah/rivers. The next statement will be issued Sunday morning at 1115 AM EST.
